library.description: RequireJS is a JavaScript file and module loader. It is optimized for in-browser use, but it can be used in other JavaScript environments, like Rhino and Node. Using a modular script loader like RequireJS will improve the speed and quality of your code.
library.name: RequireJS

library.description:
JavaScript loader
Load scripts in parallel but execute in order
library.name: headjs

library.description: browser-side require() the node.js way
library.name: browserify

library.description:
A Conditional Script Loader For Your Polyfills, or Regressive Enhancement With Style.

A small script loader to help use feature detection to load exactly the scripts that your user needs, not just all the scripts that you think they might need.
library.name: yepnope.js

library.description:
$script.js - Async JavaScript loader and dependency manager
$script.js is an asynchronous JavaScript loader and dependency manager with an astonishingly impressive lightweight footprint. Like many other script loaders, $script.js allows you to load script resources on-demand from any URL and not block other resources from loading (like CSS and images). Furthermore, it's unique interface allows developers to work easily with even the most complicated dependencies, which can often be the case for large, complex web applications.
library.name: script.js

library.description: A replacement AMD loader for RequireJS. It is a smaller "shim" loader, providing the minimal AMD API footprint that includes loader plugin support.
library.name: almond

library.description:
The steal script is a script loader and dependency management tool. Features:

Load JavaScript, CSS, Less, CoffeeScript, and a variety of client-side templates.
Load files relative to the current file, stealâ€™s root folder, your server, or from other domains.
Load a single file only once (the whole dependency management thing).
library.name: StealJS

library.description: FuckItJS uses state-of-the-art technology to make sure your javascript code runs whether your compiler likes it or not.
library.name: FuckItJS

library.description: LABjs (Loading And Blocking JavaScript) is an open-source (MIT license) project supported by Getify Solutions. The core purpose of LABjs is to be an all-purpose, on-demand JavaScript loader, capable of loading any JavaScript resource, from any location, into any page, at any time. Loading your scripts with LABjs reduces resource blocking during page-load, which is an easy and effective way to optimize your site's performance.
library.name: LABjs

library.description:
LazyLoad is a tiny (only 966 bytes minified and gzipped), dependency-free JavaScript utility that makes it super easy to load external JavaScript and CSS files on demand.

Whenever possible, LazyLoad will automatically load resources in parallel while ensuring execution order when you specify an array of URLs to load. In browsers that don't preserve the execution order of asynchronously-loaded scripts, LazyLoad will safely load the scripts sequentially.
library.name: LazyLoad

library.description: easyXDM is a Javascript library that enables you as a developer to easily work around the limitation set in place by the Same Origin Policy, in turn making it easy to communicate and expose javascript API's across domain boundaries.
library.name: easyXDM

library.description: PxLoader is a Javascript library that helps you download images, sound files or anything else you need before you take a specific action on your site (like showing a user interface or starting a game). You can use it to create a preloader for HTML5 games and websites.
library.name: PxLoader

library.description:
load.js is a micro JS lazy-loader

Built on top of chain.js, it allows you to lazy load your JS scripts sequentially or in parallel and handle complex dependency chains.
library.name: load.js

library.description:
LMD - JavaScript Module-Assembler for building better web applications

Why LMD?

You can write your modules in any style: LMD, AMD, Node.js, your_own. LMD package is fully-zero-isolated from globals. Config inheritance: Easy to setup multiply builds. Flexible source: from 500bytes. Integrated code-coverage, source analytics tools, transparent localStorage cache.
library.name: LMD

library.description: A javascript library to preload images, audio, video and other resources on a HTML5 page to cache before using them.
library.name: html5-preloader

library.description:
curl (cujo resource loader)
curl.js is a small and very fast AMD-compliant asynchronous loader
library.name: curl

library.description:
JQuery Loader

Help to async load jQuery and supporting inline javascript with calls like
$(function(){})
or
$(document).ready(function(){})
library.name: jQl

library.description:
Versatile & Complete Cross-Platform CommonJS JavaScript Module, Package & Program Loader
The PINF JavaScript Loader asynchronously combines what you would traditionally call a package installer and class loader and is intended to be used as the core to all your JavaScript applications no matter what platform they run on.
library.name: loader-js

library.description: Java Script loader
library.name: wreq

library.description: NBL.js is a tiny script that will make your HTML pages load faster by loading all your JavaScript files asynchronously (in parallel) with the rest of your page. Normally if you include two or three scripts in your page, the browser will wait for them to be executed before your page is shown.
library.name: NBL.js 2.0

library.description: jQuery.pluginautoload load your plugins on html DOM without javascript code. This plugin is same as dojo or jQuery mobile system.
library.name: jQuery PluginAutoload

library.description: Simplifies Javascript package creation, distribution, and implementation. This library allows you to include a Javascript extension and all of its dependencies with one line of code.
library.name: Fractal.js

library.description: A powerful, extensible dependency injection micro container for JavaScript applications.  Works in node and in ES5 compliant browsers.
library.name: BottleJS

library.description: Module loader and dependency manager for javascript implementing the classic include-style syntax. Module format is cross-compatible between web environment and Node.js.
library.name: Helios Kernel

library.description:
semantic cross platform module loader
In this era where JavaScript is used in both browsers and server side, there is still no module loader able to scale across platforms so .
library.name: yuno

library.description: Loader is a Dependency Locator that injects dependencies in to classes based on string suggestions. It is built for use with the Closure Library and allows different types of dependencies to be registered and objects to be instantiated asynchronously when their dependencies are met
library.name: Loader

library.description: KModule is a pure and light implemention of CommonJS Modules/AsynchronousDefinition and Modules/LoaderPlugin.
library.name: kmodule

library.description: [A]synchronous JavaScript Importing & Loading Extension enables namespace creation and on-demand script loading in browser-based JavaScript environments.
library.name: ajile

library.description:
A heavily modified (and powerful!) evolution of ControlJS, by Steve Souders
DominateJS allows you to asynchronously load all your JavaScript, and defer sequential execution until the page loads. DominateJS aims to be a cross-browser and 100% document.write-safe library!
library.name: DominateJS

library.description: Highly performant, light ~0.5kb and configurable lazy loader in pure JS with no dependencies for images, iframes and more
library.name: Lozad.js

library.description: Conditioner.js is a javascript library for loading and unloading behavior based on environment conditions.
library.name: Conditioner

library.description:
The RaptorJS Optimizer is a Node.js-style module bundler that also provides first-level support for optimally delivering JavaScript, CSS, images and other assets to the browser.

This tool offers many different optimizations such as a bundling, code splitting, lazy loading, compression and fingerprinted resource URLs. Plugins are provided to support pre-processors and compilers such as Less, Stylus and Marko. This developer-friendly tool does not require that you change the way that you already code and can easily be adopted by existing applications.
library.name: RaptorJS Optimizer

library.description: A Javascript / PHP library to manage packaging elements from server side to client side.
library.name: wjs

library.description: Bootstrap is a small library for dynamically loading JavaScript files.
library.name: Bootstrap

library.description: BravoJS is an implementation of an unratified proposed draft for CommonJS Modules/2.0
library.name: BravoJS

library.description: ControlJS is a JavaScript module for making scripts load faster.
library.name: ControlJS

library.description:
Hydra is the library that will help you to scale your app.
Hydra.js is a framework that gives you the tools to write your application using modules or widgets and make easy to work with them.
library.name: Hydra

library.description: JavaScript Loader
library.name: JSL

library.description: The Get Utility makes it easy to dynamically load JavaScript and CSS resources and be notified when they've finished loading. Get is used internally by the YUI Loader to load YUI modules and by the JSONP module to make JSONP requests. The Get Utility is transactional in nature and is capable of loading multiple resources either serially or in parallel.
library.name: YUI 3: Get

library.description: bdLoad is a highly optimized Javascript module loader that implements the CommonJS asynchronous module definition specification and more
library.name: bdLoad
